question: A queue follows the ________ principle for inserting and removing elements.
In a queue, elements are inserted at the ________ end.
A queue is considered full when the ________ reaches the maximum size.
A ________ queue allows elements to be removed from the front and inserted at the rear.
To efficiently use memory in a queue, we implement a ________ queue.
A queue is said to be ________ when there is no element in it.
If the rear of a circular queue reaches the last position and space is available at the front, it moves to the ________ position.
A ________ queue allows elements to be inserted or removed from both ends.
A priority queue assigns ________ to each element before processing.
In an emergency room, a ________ queue is used to treat critical patients first.
